parsetree.*:
<root><template><title>Command</title><part><name>Comments</name>=<value>
____________________________________________________________________________________________

</value></part><part><name index="1"/><value> arma3 </value></part><part><name>Game name</name>=<value>

</value></part><part><name index="2"/><value>1.34</value></part><part><name>Game version</name>=<value>

</value></part><part><name>arg</name>=<value> global</value></part><part><name>Multiplayer Arguments</name>=<value>

</value></part><part><name>gr1</name>=<value> Object Manipulation </value></part><part><name>GROUP1</name>=<value>
____________________________________________________________________________________________

</value></part><part><name index="3"/><value> Returns an array with all crew inside given vehicle, with or without empty seats.

<template lineStart="1"><title>Important </title><part><name index="1"/><value> With the introduction of person turrets (FFV), the returned ''cargoIndex'' works with [[moveInCargo]] but does not with [[action]]s such as "GetInCargo" and "MoveToCargo". To find out indexes for actions, use the "cargo" filter (See [[#Examples|Example 3]]).</value></part></template> </value></part><part><name>DESCRIPTION</name>=<value>
____________________________________________________________________________________________

</value></part><part><name index="4"/><value> [[fullCrew]] vehicle </value></part><part><name>SYNTAX</name>=<value>

</value></part><part><name>p1 </name>=<value> vehicle: [[Object]]

</value></part><part><name index="5"/><value> [[Array]] - list of arrays in format [unit, role, cargoIndex, turretPath, personTurret]:
* unit: [[Object]]
* role: [[String]] - not always lowercase
* cargoIndex: [[Number]]
* turretPath: [[Array]]
* personTurret: [[Boolean]] </value></part><part><name>RETURNVALUE</name>=<value>
____________________________________________________________________________________________

</value></part><part><name>s2</name>=<value> [[fullCrew]] [vehicle, type, includeEmpty] </value></part><part><name>SYNTAX2</name>=<value>

</value></part><part><name>p21</name>=<value> vehicle: [[Object]]

</value></part><part><name>p22</name>=<value> type: [[String]] - role filter (case-insensitive). An invalid value (e.g "") will return all positions. Available values:
* "driver"
* "commander"
* "gunner"
* "turret"
* "cargo"

</value></part><part><name>p23</name>=<value> <template><title>GVI</title><part><name index="1"/><value>arma3</value></part><part><name index="2"/><value>1.56</value></part></template> includeEmpty: [[Boolean]] - (Optional, default [[false]]) include empty crew seats <template><title>since</title><part><name index="1"/><value>arma3</value></part><part><name index="2"/><value>1.55.133810</value></part><part><name index="3"/><value>y</value></part></template>

</value></part><part><name>r2</name>=<value> [[Array]] - list of arrays in format [unit, role, cargoIndex, turretPath, personTurret]:
* unit: [[Object]]
* role: [[String]] - not always lowercase
* cargoIndex: [[Number]]
* turretPath: [[Array]]
* personTurret: [[Boolean]] </value></part><part><name>RETURNVALUE2</name>=<value>
____________________________________________________________________________________________

</value></part><part><name>x1</name>=<value> <code>_list = [[fullCrew]] [[vehicle]] [[player]];</code> </value></part><part><name>EXAMPLE1</name>=<value>

</value></part><part><name>x2</name>=<value> <code>_list = [[fullCrew]] [<ext><name>nowiki</name><attr/></ext>[[vehicle]] [[player]], "turret"];</code> </value></part><part><name>EXAMPLE2</name>=<value>

</value></part><part><name>x3</name>=<value> <code>[[private]] _actionCompatibleCargoIndexes = [[fullCrew]] [heli, "cargo", [[true]]];
<template lineStart="1"><title>codecomment</title><part><name index="1"/><value>/*
	returns for example (on an armed WY-55 Hellcat):
	[
		[<ext><name>nowiki</name><attr/></ext>[[objNull]], "cargo" ,2, [], [[false]]],
		[<ext><name>nowiki</name><attr/></ext>[[objNull]], "cargo", 3, [], [[false]]],
		[<ext><name>nowiki</name><attr/></ext>[[objNull]], "cargo", 4, [], [[false]]],
		[<ext><name>nowiki</name><attr/></ext>[[objNull]], "cargo", 5, [], [[false]]]
	]
	using the element's index is compatible with action cargo commands - see below
<ext><name>nowiki</name><attr/></ext>*/</value></part></template>

<template lineStart="1"><title>cc</title><part><name index="1"/><value>the following commands will put the player in the same seat:</value></part></template>
[[player]] [[moveInCargo]] [heli, 2];
[[player]] [[action]] ["GetInCargo", heli, 0];
</code> </value></part><part><name>EXAMPLE3</name>=<value>

</value></part><part><name index="6"/><value> [[crew]], [[createVehicleCrew]], [[assignedVehicleRole]], [[allTurrets]] </value></part><part><name>SEEALSO</name>=<value>
</value></part></template>
